channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: @indybend I haven't seen one yet in our area. In St. Louis, there is a bold and explicit sign saying no open carry weapons at one of the regional chain grocery stores.
item.source:markdown: @indybend I haven't seen one yet in our area. In St. Louis, there is a bold and explicit sign saying no open carry weapons at one of the regional chain grocery stores.

item.description: Twitter doesn't care about the design of our posts, but it could. Look how little typographical freedom it takes to make the organization of a post instantly clear: https://t.co/yUldeZhBJw https://t.co/04d14IeD4i
item.source:markdown: Twitter doesn't care about the design of our posts, but it could. Look how little typographical freedom it takes to make the organization of a post instantly clear: https://t.co/yUldeZhBJw https://t.co/04d14IeD4i

item.description: Twitter + Markdown + RSS, or design as if human readers matter. https://t.co/Boh7HGg3Bt
item.source:markdown: Twitter + Markdown + RSS, or design as if human readers matter. https://t.co/Boh7HGg3Bt

item.description: @davewiner Q: Why do people retire? A: To have more of a say in how you spend your one life.
item.source:markdown:
@davewiner Q: Why do people retire?
A: To have more of a say in how you spend your one life.

item.description: I've been asking our regional Martin's Supermarkets and their owners, SpartanNash, to say whether company policy allows for open carry of weapons by customers in the stores. Somebody had a holstered pistol in our neighborhood store not long ago. No answer after about three weeks.
item.source:markdown: I've been asking our regional Martin's Supermarkets and their owners, SpartanNash, to say whether company policy allows for open carry of weapons by customers in the stores. Somebody had a holstered pistol in our neighborhood store not long ago. No answer after about three weeks.

item.description: @SBTOutdoors I remember one of the little towns we passed in southeastern Alaska on the Ferry that looked like it was using the shoreline as the town dump.
item.source:markdown: @SBTOutdoors I remember one of the little towns we passed in southeastern Alaska on the Ferry that looked like it was using the shoreline as the town dump.

item.description: @SBTOutdoors The Chilkoot Trail was very little developed when we walked it. It was easy to go astray, and we did. There was no helicopter to bring a struggling tourist out like we saw in the Grand Canyon a few weeks before.
item.source:markdown: @SBTOutdoors The Chilkoot Trail was very little developed when we walked it. It was easy to go astray, and we did. There was no helicopter to bring a struggling tourist out like we saw in the Grand Canyon a few weeks before.

item.description: @HormoneHangover My father told one of his work friends about the trip in my presence the next year as if it was kind of a cool accomplishment, but I'm sure he disapproved of the risk of getting off track in life too. My mother's view--one could still ask...
item.source:markdown: @HormoneHangover My father told one of his work friends about the trip in my presence the next year as if it was kind of a cool accomplishment, but I'm sure he disapproved of the risk of getting off track in life too. My mother's view--one could still ask...

item.description: @HormoneHangover Yes: ✅ Route: scenic ✅ Boardwalk: decayed ✅ Boots: soaked ✅ College: delayed
item.source:markdown:
@HormoneHangover Yes:
✅ Route: scenic
✅ Boardwalk: decayed
✅ Boots: soaked
✅ College: delayed

item.description: Teaching students to use links back in the 2000s. https://t.co/zfqSrH8MrM
item.source:markdown: Teaching students to use links back in the 2000s. https://t.co/zfqSrH8MrM

item.description:
In 1973, I spent 50¢ for an old used guidebook to Alaska. I found it for sale on a table of culled books in the entry at the public library. The chapters on southeastern Alaska recommended one remote town’s forest boardwalk.
The boardwalk, shown in a dim black and white photo (the book was full of these), was described as a scenic shortcut through ferny evergreen forest and wetland to a secluded, pebbly spot along the shore.
Walking that way in 1974, we found long stretches of its wet planks crumbling into shady, mossy, sodden soil. The purpose of the 11-week trip was to explore the longest possible route from home to a nearby college.
✅ Route: scenic ✅ Boots: soaked ✅ College: delayed
Moral of the story: While carrying out research, use caution when consulting older sources.
item.source:markdown:
In 1973, I spent 50¢ for an old used guidebook to Alaska. I found it for sale on a table of culled books in the entry at the public library. The chapters on southeastern Alaska recommended one remote town’s forest boardwalk.
The boardwalk, shown in a dim black and white photo (the book was full of these), was described as a scenic shortcut through ferny evergreen forest and wetland to a secluded, pebbly spot along the shore.
Walking that way in 1974, we found long stretches of its wet planks crumbling into shady, mossy, sodden soil. The purpose of the 11-week trip was to explore the longest possible route from home to a nearby college.
✅ Route: scenic
✅ Boots: soaked
✅ College: delayed
Moral of the story: While carrying out research, use caution when consulting older sources.

item.description: What makes a good API? I like the question even though I don’t have the skill to help answer it. Sounds like some law librarians at their #aall22 conference have been talking this over this afternoon. Sample slides: https://t.co/hJ8cdzRVuE
item.source:markdown:
What makes a good API?
I like the question even though I don’t have the skill to help answer it.

item.description: I hear that in a Joe Pickett novel by C. J. Box, set in Wyoming and nearby states, you’re sure to see Joe destroy a pickup truck, Marybeth solve murders in Saddlestring, and Nate get revenge. A friend recommends them. https://t.co/rOAAKlc6Tw
item.source:markdown: I hear that in a Joe Pickett novel by C. J. Box, set in Wyoming and nearby states, you’re sure to see Joe destroy a pickup truck, Marybeth solve murders in Saddlestring, and Nate get revenge. A friend recommends them. https://t.co/rOAAKlc6Tw

item.description: @davewiner Yes. In 1974, in southeast Alaska, a driver who gave a lift said he was just back from Anchorage, where he saw an unfamiliar thing hanging over the road. “Wow,” he reported saying, “wow, that thing must be a stoplight.”
item.source:markdown: @davewiner Yes. In 1974, in southeast Alaska, a driver who gave a lift said he was just back from Anchorage, where he saw an unfamiliar thing hanging over the road. “Wow,” he reported saying, “wow, that thing must be a stoplight.”

item.description: School teaches the wrong things a good part of the time, but wouldn't have to. Here's the whole "There should be a week-long unit in school each year" collection to date. https://t.co/tehLNM9tz6
item.source:markdown: School teaches the wrong things a good part of the time, but wouldn't have to. Here's the whole "There should be a week-long unit in school each year" collection to date. https://t.co/tehLNM9tz6

item.description: There should be a week-long unit in school each year detailing the ways the powerful, for the sake of appearances, post their plans in various out-of-the-way places "for public viewing and comment" before they smash a fist down on that big green GO button right there on the desk. https://t.co/vP1SKWj0Q5 https://t.co/lKJ9JBiwop
item.source:markdown: There should be a week-long unit in school each year detailing the ways the powerful, for the sake of appearances, post their plans in various out-of-the-way places "for public viewing and comment" before they smash a fist down on that big green GO button right there on the desk. https://t.co/vP1SKWj0Q5 https://t.co/lKJ9JBiwop

item.description: As mayor, at public gatherings, @PeteButtigieg made a point of talking to anyone who indicated that they hoped to have a word. He was speaking with people he knew well once when I walked up. In a moment or two he excused himself from those folks and turned to me, a stranger. https://t.co/scxS6MJ8NP
item.source:markdown: As mayor, at public gatherings, @PeteButtigieg made a point of talking to anyone who indicated that they hoped to have a word. He was speaking with people he knew well once when I walked up. In a moment or two he excused himself from those folks and turned to me, a stranger. https://t.co/scxS6MJ8NP
